 I can ping 127.0.0.1; but ZoneAlarm is set to Ask

> a=
nd The test

sing RemoteTestRunner?

 Eclipse/JUnit?
> >   OR

Hi,

Most =
people get by fine with allowing 127.0.0.1 as the loopback address.  You mi=
ght enter a bug with the Eclipse folks for your esoteric super-secure confi=
guration, and ask for a configuration mechanism to set the IP address for t=
he RemoteTestRunner. But, if you can, just re-enable 127.0.0.1 as the loopb=
ack address.

My hypothesis is that the RemoteTestRunner was written to sup=
port Eclipse plugin testing, where the test launcher creates a new Eclipse =
workspace to run a set of plugin tests. The results are displayed in the or=
iginal workspace's test runner UI.  That is, the RemoteTestRunner talks ove=
r RMI or HTTP to the new launched workspace to get the test results.

Scott=
 Stirling
